caption:
This photograph depicts a large musical ensemble, likely a band or choir, consisting of approximately twenty-seven men dressed in similar attire. The men are wearing light gray suits coordinated with white shirts and ties that are adorned with a yellow and black pattern. They are posed in three rows, providing a layered group image. 

The front row features seated men holding musical instruments: one is holding a guitar, and two are holding accordions. Beside them, in the center of the group, a large bass drum labeled "The Concord Singers New Ulm, Minn" is prominently displayed. 

The background of the image shows a painted mural, giving the appearance of an old European village with stone and brick buildings set against a mountainous landscape under a cloudy sky. The lighting primarily focuses on the group, drawing attention to their expressions and attire.

Above the group, a chandelier with five visible lights adds a formal touch to the setting, suggesting the photograph might have been taken in a hall or a similar venue. The overall composition of the photograph portrays a sense of unity and culture, likely emphasizing community and musical tradition associated with their location, New Ulm, Minnesota.
title: Group photograph of the concord singers, members of the community of New Ulm, Minnesota, who specialize in german songs the town was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company the group is made up of men of varying occupations, and includes newcomers who work in the manufacturing plants as well as life-long residents.  Twenty years ago many of the town's inhabitants could speak some german, but the tradition is dying and the singers are trying to keep the heritage alive
